snippet: Calling the messaging around the recalls “tortured at best,” lawmakers expressed frustration with both the airbag maker and a federal auto safety agency.
abstract: Lawmakers at congressional hearing sharply press Takata about underlying safety of ammonium nitrate, propellant that company uses to power airbags and which it intends to continue using amid expanded recall; experts have said substance is highly sensitive to moisture and temperature changes, making it susceptible to disintegration and ultimately violent combustion.

byline.original: By AARON M. KESSLER and HIROKO TABUCHI
byline.contributor: Aaron M. Kessler reported from Washington and Hiroko Tabuchi from New York. Danielle Ivory contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Calling the messaging around the recalls “tortured at best,” lawmakers expressed frustration with both the airbag maker and a federal auto safety agency.

headline.main: Lawmakers Press Takata on Propellant in Airbags
